Subject: Censors, Lies, and Videotape: Moral Outrage in the VHS Horror Era
Description: The advent of home video created an era of anything goes filmmaking, especially in horror, which naturally led to attempts to regulate from sources of moral majority within the governments. This open panel discussion will talk about this era in history and the films made in that time, with an attempt to explore a more global perspective over last year's 'Video Nasties' discussion. 18+ due to subject matter in the films discussed  Speakers include:Edward M Fleece - Track: Media  - Duration: 1 hour
